clusters.title: Deadly Austin bar shooting investigated as possible terror attack
clusters.neutral_headline: Austin Bar Shooting Investigated As Terror Attack

items.title: Deadly Austin bar shooting investigated as possible terror attack
items.standfirst: The FBI is investigating a shooting that killed two people at an Austin, Texas, bar as a possible terror attack. Jason Allen reports.
items.content: The FBI is investigating a shooting that killed two people at an Austin, Texas, bar as a possible terror attack. Jason Allen reports.

items.title: Gunman kills two in Texas bar shooting, FBI probing ‘terrorism’ link
items.standfirst: Suspect fired from SUV, then got out of the vehicle and opened fire with a rifle before being killed by officers.
items.content: Suspect fired from SUV, then got out of the vehicle and opened fire with a rifle before being killed by officers.

items.title: Deadly Texas bar shooting 'potentially act of terrorism', FBI says
items.standfirst: Two people were killed and 14 injured, with the suspected gunman, identified by some media outlets, also shot dead.
items.content: Two people were killed and 14 injured, with the suspected gunman, identified by some media outlets, also shot dead.

ai_summary: Two people killed in Austin bar shooting
FBI investigating possible terror attack
Suspect fired from SUV and killed by officers
Fourteen people injured in the shooting
Investigation ongoing to determine motive

clusters.title: UK PM Starmer says US can use UK bases for ‘defensive strikes’ on Iran
clusters.neutral_headline: UK To Allow US To Use Bases For Defensive Strikes

items.title: UK PM Starmer says US can use UK bases for ‘defensive strikes’ on Iran
items.standfirst: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer says he’s accepted a request from the US to let his country’s military bases be used.
items.content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer says he’s accepted a request from the US to let his country’s military bases be used.

items.title: UK to allow US to use British bases for defensive strikes against Iran
items.standfirst: Keir Starmer says the UK has not been involved in the US-Israeli strikes, but warned that 200,000 British people are in countries being targeted by IranThe UK has agreed to let the US use British military bases to attack Iranian missile sites, Keir Starmer has said.The UK has so far not been involved in the US-Israeli strikes on Iran, but in a recorded statement on Sunday evening, the prime minister said that Iran’s approach was becoming more reckless and putting British lives at risk, leading to the decision to allow the US to use two of its military bases. Continue reading...
items.content: Keir Starmer says the UK has not been involved in the US-Israeli strikes, but warned that 200,000 British people are in countries being targeted by IranThe UK has agreed to let the US use British military bases to attack Iranian missile sites, Keir Starmer has said.The UK has so far not been involved in the US-Israeli strikes on Iran, but in a recorded statement on Sunday evening, the prime minister said that Iran’s approach was becoming more reckless and putting British lives at risk, leading to the decision to allow the US to use two of its military bases. Continue reading...

items.title: UK will allow US to use bases to strike Iranian missile sites, PM says
items.standfirst: The prime minister says it remains the case that the UK will "not join offensive action now".
items.content: The prime minister says it remains the case that the UK will "not join offensive action now".

ai_summary: UK agrees to let US use military bases
Bases to be used for defensive strikes on Iran
UK not involved in US-Israeli strikes on Iran
Decision made due to Iran's reckless approach
UK warns of risk to British lives

clusters.title: RAF responding to suspected drone strike at UK base in Cyprus, MoD says
clusters.neutral_headline: Suspected Drone Strike Hits UK Base In Cyprus

items.title: RAF responding to suspected drone strike at UK base in Cyprus, MoD says
items.standfirst: The BBC understands there were no casualties in the suspected strike on RAF Akrotiri.
items.content: The BBC understands there were no casualties in the suspected strike on RAF Akrotiri.

items.title: RAF base in Cyprus hit by suspected drone strike
items.standfirst: The RAF base Akrotiri has been hit by a suspected drone strike, the Ministry of Defence (MoD) has confirmed, amid a fresh conflict in the Middle East that started on Saturday.
items.content: The RAF base Akrotiri has been hit by a suspected drone strike, the Ministry of Defence (MoD) has confirmed, amid a fresh conflict in the Middle East that started on Saturday.

ai_summary: RAF base in Cyprus hit by suspected drone
No casualties reported in the suspected strike
Ministry of Defence confirms the incident
Incident occurs amid Middle East conflict
Investigation into the incident ongoing

clusters.title: Why did Arsenal beat Chelsea? #sports
clusters.neutral_headline: Arsenal Beats Chelsea In London Derby

items.title: Why did Arsenal beat Chelsea? #sports
items.standfirst: Set pieces and a last‑ditch save decided a tense London derby Arsenal took a hard‑earned three points in a match that largely hinged on two well‑worked set plays and a dramatic late intervention from their goalkeeper. The Gunners scored twice from corners, a pattern that has become a clear…

The Gunners scored twice from corners, a pattern that has become a clear…

items.title: 'Ugly' or 'beautiful'? Set-pieces prove decisive for Arsenal again
items.standfirst: Arsenal move five points clear in the Premier League title race but is their reliance on set-pieces an issue?
items.content: Arsenal move five points clear in the Premier League title race but is their reliance on set-pieces an issue?

items.title: How did Arsenal’s win over Chelsea reshape the title race? #sports
items.standfirst: Set pieces and a late save swing the standings Arsenal relied on the two areas that have defined their season — corner routines and a match saving goalkeeper — to beat Chelsea 2 1 and restore a five point cushion at the top of the Premier League. The decisive moments came from well executed set…

Set pieces prove decisive in the match
Arsenal scores twice from corner kicks
Late save by goalkeeper secures the win

clusters.title: Allies of US in the Gulf bear brunt of Iran attacks
clusters.neutral_headline: Iran Attacks Target Gulf Arab States

items.title: Allies of US in the Gulf bear brunt of Iran attacks
items.standfirst: Iran's attacks on Gulf Arab states suggest the Islamic Republic is targeting not just the US military but also civilian infrastructure.
items.content: Iran's attacks on Gulf Arab states suggest the Islamic Republic is targeting not just the US military but also civilian infrastructure.

items.content: Islamic republic launches constant barrages at Israel while targeting civilian sites around the Gulf

clusters.title: What Happens If Iran Shuts Down the Strait of Hormuz?
clusters.neutral_headline: Conflict In Iran Threatens Global Economy

items.title: What Happens If Iran Shuts Down the Strait of Hormuz?
items.standfirst: The Strait of Hormuz is one of the most sensitive pressure points in the global economy. Conflict in Iran could put it at risk indefinitely.
items.content: The Strait of Hormuz is one of the most sensitive pressure points in the global economy. Conflict in Iran could put it at risk indefinitely.

items.title: What will war in Iran do to the global economy?
items.standfirst: Conflict has exposed how much growth depends on energy supplies through the Strait of Hormuz
items.content: Conflict has exposed how much growth depends on energy supplies through the Strait of Hormuz

ai_summary: Iran conflict risks disrupting oil supplies
Strait of Hormuz a critical pressure point
Global economy depends on energy supplies
Conflict in Iran could have far-reaching effects
Economic instability a major concern
